intro: Sebaea caudata, commonly known as the trailing sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and often have a fuzzy texture. Sebaea caudata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
